children: The effect of early detection (screening) on survival after diagnosis. (
) Screening is not implemented, and the disease takes its normal course. (
) Lead-time bias occurs when survival time appears to be lengthened because disease is diagnosed in the screened patient during the preclinical phase, but the patient does not live longer. (
) Screening effectively detects disease during the asymptomatic phase, and survival time is lengthened.
